column1: Carbon monoxide is an odorless gas that causes thousands of deaths each year in North America.
Carbon monoxide is a chemical produced from the incomplete burning of natural gas or other products containing carbon.

The person may receive: - Airway support, including oxygen, breathing tube through the mouth (intubation), and breathing machine (ventilator) - Blood and urine tests - Chest x-ray - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Fluids through a vein (intravenous or IV) - Hyperbaric oxygen therapy (high-pressure oxygen given in a special chamber) - Medicines to treat symptoms
